articles.title: Optimism proposes OP token buybacks using 50% of superchain revenue
articles.description: Under the proposal, which is set to move to a governance vote on January 22, Optimism would begin monthly buybacks starting in February.

articles.title: JPMorgan says the crypto selloff may be nearing a bottom as ETF outflows ease
articles.description: Flow and positioning data suggest the recent crypto market correction may be running out of steam, with early signs of stabilization across ETFs and derivatives.

articles.title: Polymarket user who won $400K on Maduro ouster bet quietly disappears
articles.description: The Polymarket account that profited on Nicholas Maduro's capture and ouster as president is inaccessible, adding to concerns over insider trading allegations on prediction markets.

articles.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
articles.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

articles.title: Zcash backer Bootstrap says split due to clash over nonprofit rules, Zashi future
articles.description: Zcash’s nonprofit backer Bootstrap said governance tensions stem from nonprofit limits on outside investment, following a split with Electric Coin Company.

articles.title: Coincheck signs $112 million stock purchase agreement for majority stake in digital asset manager 3iQ
articles.description: The deal is expected to close in Q2 2026 and could give Coincheck ownership of 3iQ’s regulated crypto ETFs and fund platforms.

articles.title: Florida Revives Bitcoin Reserve Push With New 2026 Bill
articles.description:
Bitcoin Magazine

Florida Revives Bitcoin Reserve Push With New 2026 Bill
Florida lawmakers filed new legislation for the 2026 session that would create a state-run crypto reserve after a similar effo

articles.title: Digital Finance Will Evolve Into ‘Foundational Infrastructure Layer’ in 2026: Moody’s
articles.description: The ratings agency predicts that financial institutions and service firms will compete on the effectiveness of their infrastructure layers.

articles.title: CoinDesk 20 Performance Update: Ripple (XRP) Drops 4.5% as Nearly All Assets Decline
articles.description: Aptos (APT) was also an underperformer, down 5% from Wednesday.

articles.title: Tokenized Brazilian credit card debt offers 13% yield through BlackOpal's GemStone platform
articles.description: The initiative leverages the Plume Network to tokenize credit card receivables, while giving merchants immediate access to cash.

articles.title: Stand With Crypto advocacy group sees nearly 700,000 new members ahead of 2026 election
articles.description: The organization established by Coinbase to mobilize crypto enthusiasts has built up a 2.6-million-member base across 50 state chapters as U.S. elections loom.

articles.title: Nvidia’s Vera Rubin keeps crypto networks like Render in demand
articles.description: Nvidia’s Vera Rubin slashes AI costs, challenging decentralized GPU networks like Render that thrive on scarce and underused computing power.

articles.title: Digital assets to move from speculation to infrastructure in 2026, B. Riley says
articles.description: Regulatory clarity, tokenization and bank adoption will push crypto firms from balance-sheet accumulation toward real operations.

articles.title: China’s interest-bearing digital yuan piles pressure on US stablecoin rules
articles.description: China’s move to pay interest on the digital yuan is colliding with the GENIUS Act’s ban on stablecoin yields, intensifying questions over whether US digital dollars can remain competitive.

articles.title: Morning Minute: The Institutions Aren’t Coming—They’re Here
articles.description: Four major headlines across TradFi and U.S. States has crypto on notice—the institutions are charging in
